milestone.description:
Priorities **in priority order** for the 0.13 milestone:

**1. Finish items started in 0.12**
- Complete any outstanding issues related to pairing (for syncing) - Igor
- Implement the 'Admin' role (issue #10114) - Mykhailo
- Any remaining work to pay off tech. debt related to mutual contacts - Mishka
- When creating/editing token based permission, ability to search for and selecting Collectables from OpenSea - MichaelC

**2. Channel token permissions**
- Create, edit and delete channel token permissions in the permissions admin screens
- This includes the "no tokens required to view this channel" permission
- All user facing channel token permissions functionality e.g. what happens when a user tries to access a token gated channel they don't have the required tokens to access, what happens when a user only has permissions to view a channel, etc...
- If a community is an open (not token gated at the community level) community, if a channel is token gated AND if **no** "no tokens required to view this channel" permission for that channel exists, then the channel should be automatically encrypted.  If token gating is removed from a channel, the channel should become unencrypted.

**3. DB perf improvements**
- https://www.notion.so/Database-related-performance-1dbaa7ea894c461d885e55676683be07
- Alex and Patryk to work on this, with help from Lukáš

**4. Update app to use new 'Share URL' formats**
- add functionality to status-go to generate the new 'Share URL' formats for sharing links to: User Profiles, Communities, Channel inside a Community (issue https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10851)
- Update everywhere a user can share a URL from to use the new URL format (issue https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10852)
- New/updated URL unroll designs for inside chat, including specific unrolls for the new User Profile, Community and Channel inside a Community URLs (issue https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10585)
- Ability to share a URL that points to a specific channel in a community (issue #10160)
- Update all address inputs to accept a user pasting a 'share URL' into the input (in addition to being able to input the raw address).  This includes: Start new chat input, send contact request input in Settings, the import community key input, etc...
- Update Status Desktops URL handler so that if Status is installed on a computer, when a user clicks on a Status 'Share URL' the app is launched (if not already running) and after signing in the user is automatically taken to the entity the Share URL represented inside the app.  e.g. if a user clicks on a URL for a Status Community, the user should be taken to the home screen for that community inside the Status App

**5. Mint Assets functionality**
- Also includes some small improvements to the mint Collectables functionality
- Noelia, GravityBlast

**6. Profile showcase backend**


**--- For the Wallet team ---**
tldr; continue building out Ben's wallet designs

1. Complete any outstanding development related to the activity screens
2. All accounts overview screens
3. New settings screens
4. Implement 'imported key and account' syncing and transfer between devices

body:
# Bug Report

- the `#desktop` channel has unread messages but the primary nav doesn't show any badge
- its parent `Desktop` category doesn't show in bold(er) either as it should

![image_11-04-2023_19-35-01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5377645/231243629-a13fec66-bfaf-453f-a72e-d32f4abd7a3d.png)

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: master
- Operating System: linux

I was about to report the same issue.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33099791/231437312-3cb50964-58d6-4543-98e3-4b2964f949d0.mp4
Note, it happens on 0.11.0 RC2 and is a good candidate for release blocker. cc: @jrainville

Better but... still not quite right:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5377645/231999691-6033ee7d-3b81-4ca8-aea1-b5e300005575.png)

Primary nav badge is fine (:heavy_check_mark:), `people-ops` has new messages (:heavy_check_mark:) but its parent category `General` is _not_ highlighted (:red_circle:)

Or here, where I don't have any unread private/group messages, yet the primary badge is still showing up:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5377645/232010820-814d3642-37c7-41aa-9b32-1a7180a89be6.png)

I opened those two issues to track the problems you found. 
It's gonna be easier to track, since this ticket is more about the badge not showing
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10313
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10314
Reopening because I can still reproduce in 0.12 RC1 :unamused:

Investigation update: I was able to reproduce with my release app and take a snapshot of the DB before anything could be modified.

The community didn't have a badge, nor the channels in it, but if I looked in some of the channels, there were new messages.

I used `sqlcipher` to check inside the DB and I could confirm that the `unviewed_message_count` of all channels was indeed 0, when it shouldn't.

So the problem is that the `unviewed_message_count` gets reset somehow.

I then reopened the app and did another snapshot. This time, I did have the badge on the community and two of the channels.

Again, I dug into the DB and saw that the `unviewed_message_count` was 1 (hence why we had the badges), but if I counted the `seen=0` messages, it was more than that (5 for one of them). So it seems like it's not because we `mark_as_read` accidentally, because the messages would be marked as `seen` otherwise.

I'll check everywhere that `unviewed_message_count` can be modified and see what could be the problem. It's something that affects all the channels in the community somehow.

Sadly, it's hard to reproduce, or rather it's unclear what causes it to reproduce. My one way so far has been to close at the end of day and when I reopen in the next morning, even though there are new messages, the `unviewed_message_count` value didn't update correctly or got reset.

Update2: I think I found a possible culprit.

I found that `handleImportedMessages` doesn't do `saveChat` after/while importing messages, so it's quite possible that I'm importing the new messages before getting them from the mailserver, so I now have the messages, so they are not processed by the "normal" message path that saves the chat with the updated `unviewed_message_count`.

I'm adding a test to see if that's really the case. It's hard to be sure since the code goes through a lot of loops.

I created this draft PR https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/10750 to test if the fix is really what fixes it.
I'll need to test it multiple days in a row to be sure, because I'm fairly sure this is  a race condition situation.

Update after testing my new PR: It did **not** fix it at all.

I could see the badge saying "2" on the community, then it reset to just unseen badge (normal grey circle), and only one channel was marked as unread. So something actively resets the counters.

Update after adding logs:

I can 100% confirm that we have something that fully resets the community chats:
